The DoE approach is a powerful method used to optimize processes and quantitatively estimate the effect that different variables have in a process and their possible interactions. For this work, a Full Factorial Design (2
K ) strategy was selected and two variables ( K = 2) were analyzed: calcination temperature ( X 1, in degrees) and time ( X 2, in min). The evaluated response ( Y, in percentage) was the purity of the obtained ferrite.
